meanings.definition: To cry out suddenly, especially in surprise, anger, or pain.
meanings.sent1: She exclaims when she sees a spider.
meanings.sent2: He always exclaims when he stubs his toe.
meanings.sent3: The cat exclaims when it sees a cucumber behind it.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm exclaims its power with a loud roar.
meanings.sent5: The child exclaims with delight upon finding a hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: To speak or say something loudly and emphatically.
meanings.sent1: The teacher exclaims the answer to the class.
meanings.sent2: The coach exclaims instructions during the game.
meanings.sent3: The parrot exclaims a funny phrase to entertain its owner.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock exclaims the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The singer exclaims the final note of the song with passion.
